title: Top 10 Individual Stocks That Have Outperformed the S&P 500 Over 46 Years
subtitle: Discover the top 10 individual stocks that have consistently outperformed the S&P 500 over a remarkable 46-year period, highlighting their impressive returns and significant dividends.
content:
Top 10 Individual Stocks That Have Outperformed the S&P 500 Over 46 Years

Hello, I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Now, I share financial insights for free so that you don't have to pay for them.

1. General Mills

Return: 13.58%

2. Hershey

Return: 14.2%

3. Procter & Gamble

Return: 14.6%

4. Colgate-Palmolive

Return: 15.2%

5. Pepsi

Return: 15.5%

6. Merck

Return: 15.9%

7. Pfizer

Return: 16%

8. Bristol-Myers

Return: 16.26%

9. Abbott

Return: 16.5%

10. Philip Morris

Return: 19.75%

This country loves its cigarettes. But what this country loves more is investing in companies that provide stable and long-lasting dividends.

Are all of these companies relatively boring? Maybe. Are all of these companies some of the most highly profitable in history? Absolutely. And if any of this is helpful, like and follow, and I'll keep trying to get you one step closer to where you need to be.
